title: Plaque, ca. 1777
medium:
stoneware, wood, metal
In ledger: Blue and white jasperware, wood, gilt bronze, glass
description:
Omphale (or Jöle) and frame
Vertical oval plaque of unevenly colored grayish blue solid jasper, with half-draped figure of Ophale in profile, standing on bracket and carrying the lion's skin and club of Heracles. Oval moulded frame, with laurel wreath, set into vertical oblong wooden frame, painted black. Probably no. 488 ("Jöle") in Wedgwood-Bently catalogue 1779. Bliss no. 5399. Compare waxen white biscuit plaque, Brit. Mus. (Wm. Burton, J. Wedgwood and his Pottery, NY-London, 1922, opp. p.118)
Exh.: Charlotte, N.C. The Mint Museum of Art, [1961], no. 52, p. 11.

tombstone.epitaph:
Plaque, ca. 1777. stoneware, wood, metal
In ledger: Blue and white jasperware, wood, gilt bronze, glass. Gift of Anonymous Donor. 1952-166-31-a,b.
